00038   AtomicGroup* AtomicGroup::clone(void) const {
00039     return(new AtomicGroup(*this));

00043   AtomicGroup AtomicGroup::copy(void) const {
00044     const_iterator i;
00045     AtomicGroup res;
00046 
00047     for (i = atoms.begin(); i != atoms.end(); i++) {
00048       pAtom pa(new Atom(**i));
00049       res.append(pa);
00050     }
00051     res._sorted = _sorted;
00052     res.box = box.copy();
00053 
00054     return(res);
00055   }

00058   // Internal: verify the index into the atom array...
00059   int AtomicGroup::rangeCheck(int i) const {
00060     if (i < 0)
00061       i = atoms.size() + i;
00062     if ((unsigned int)i >= atoms.size())
00063       throw(std::out_of_range("Bad index for an atom"));
00064 
00065     return(i);
00066   }
00067

00069   // Returns the ith atom...  
00070   pAtom AtomicGroup::getAtom(const int i) const {
00071     int j = rangeCheck(i);
00072 
00073     return(atoms[j]);
00074   }

00076   // Should these invalidate sort status?
00077   pAtom& AtomicGroup::operator[](const int i) {
00078     int j = rangeCheck(i);
00079     return(atoms[j]);
00080   }

00082   // For const objects...
00083   const pAtom& AtomicGroup::operator[](const int i) const {
00084     int j = rangeCheck(i);
00085     return(atoms[j]);
00086   }

00088   // Internal: removes an atom from this group based on the address of the shared pointer...
00089   void AtomicGroup::deleteAtom(pAtom pa) {
00090     std::vector<pAtom>::iterator iter;
00091 
00092     iter = find(atoms.begin(), atoms.end(), pa);
00093     if (iter == atoms.end())
00094       throw(std::runtime_error("Attempting to delete a non-existent atom"));
00095 
00096     atoms.erase(iter);
00097     _sorted = false;
00098   }

00101   // Append each atom from the passed vector onto this group...
00102   void AtomicGroup::append(std::vector<pAtom> pas) {
00103     std::vector<pAtom>::iterator i;
00104 
00105     for (i=pas.begin(); i != pas.end(); i++)
00106       atoms.push_back(*i);
00107 
00108     _sorted = false;
00109   }

00112   // Append all atoms from the passed group onto this one
00113   void AtomicGroup::append(const AtomicGroup& grp) {
00114     std::vector<pAtom>::const_iterator i;
00115 
00116     for (i=grp.atoms.begin(); i != grp.atoms.end(); i++)
00117       addAtom(*i);
00118 
00119     _sorted = false;
00120   }

00126 
00127     for (i=pas.begin(); i != pas.end(); i++)
00128       deleteAtom(*i);
00129 
00130     _sorted = false;
00131   }

00134   // Removes all atoms contained in the passed group from this one...
00135   void AtomicGroup::remove(const AtomicGroup& grp) {

00137 
00138     for (i=grp.atoms.begin(); i != grp.atoms.end(); i++)
00139       deleteAtom(*i);
00140 
00141     _sorted = false;

00170   bool AtomicGroup::allHaveProperty(const Atom::bits& property) const {
00171     for (const_iterator ci = atoms.begin(); ci != atoms.end(); ++ci)
00172       if (!(*ci)->checkProperty(property))
00173         return(false);
00174 
00175     return(true);
00176   }
00177 
00178   bool AtomicGroup::anyHaveProperty(const Atom::bits& property) const {
00179     for (const_iterator ci = atoms.begin(); ci != atoms.end(); ++ci)
00180       if ((*ci)->checkProperty(property))
00181         return(true);
00182 
00183     return(false);
00184   }

00186   bool AtomicGroup::hasBonds(void) const {
00187     const_iterator ci;
00188 
00189     for (ci = atoms.begin(); ci != atoms.end(); ++ci)
00190       if ((*ci)->checkProperty(Atom::bondsbit))
00191         return(true);
00192 
00193     return(false);
00194   }

00197   void AtomicGroup::clearBonds(void) {
00198     const_iterator ci;
00199 
00200     for (ci = atoms.begin(); ci != atoms.end(); ++ci)
00201       (*ci)->clearBonds();
00202   }

00205   bool AtomicGroup::hasCoords(void) const {
00206     const_iterator ci;
00207 
00208     for (ci = atoms.begin(); ci != atoms.end(); ++ci)
00209       if (!((*ci)->checkProperty(Atom::coordsbit)))
00210         return(false);
00211 
00212     return(true);
00213   }

00216   // Internal: sort the atom array by atomid
00217   void AtomicGroup::sort(void) {
00218     CmpById comp;
00219 
00220     if (!sorted())
00221       std::sort(atoms.begin(), atoms.end(), comp);
00222 
00223     sorted(true);
00224   }

00228   // Internal: calculates the start and stop iterators given offset and len args
00229   // as in PERL's substr()...
00230 
00231   boost::tuple<AtomicGroup::iterator, AtomicGroup::iterator> AtomicGroup::calcSubsetIterators(const int offset, const int len) {
00232     unsigned int a, b;
00233 
00234     if (offset < 0) {
00235       b = atoms.size() + offset + 1;
00236       a = (len == 0) ? 0 : b - len;
00237     } else {
00238       a = offset;
00239       b = (len == 0) ? atoms.size() : a + len;
00240     }
00241 
00242     if (b-a >= atoms.size())
00243       throw(std::range_error("Indices out of bounds for subsetting"));
00244 
00245     boost::tuple<iterator, iterator> res(atoms.begin() + a, atoms.begin() + b);
00246 
00247     return(res);
00248   }
00249 
00250 
00251 
00252   AtomicGroup AtomicGroup::subset(const int offset, const int len) {
00253     AtomicGroup res;
00254 
00255     boost::tuple<iterator, iterator> iters = calcSubsetIterators(offset, len);
00256     res.atoms.insert(res.atoms.begin(), boost::get<0>(iters), boost::get<1>(iters));
00257 
00258     res.box = box;
00259     return(res);
00260   }
00261 
00262 
00263   AtomicGroup AtomicGroup::excise(const int offset, const int len) {
00264     AtomicGroup res;
00265 
00266     boost::tuple<iterator, iterator> iters = calcSubsetIterators(offset, len);
00267 
00268     res.atoms.insert(res.atoms.begin(), boost::get<0>(iters), boost::get<1>(iters));
00269     atoms.erase(boost::get<0>(iters), boost::get<1>(iters));
00270 
00271     _sorted = false;
00272 
00273     res.box = box;
00274     return(res);
00275   }

00277   // Select atoms from the current group, adding them to a new group
00278   // based on the sel functor/predicate...
00279 
00280   AtomicGroup AtomicGroup::select(const AtomSelector& sel) const {
00281     AtomicGroup res;
00282 
00283     std::vector<pAtom>::const_iterator i;
00284     for (i=atoms.begin(); i != atoms.end(); i++)
00285       if (sel(*i))
00286         res.addAtom(*i);
00287 
00288     res.box = box;
00289     return(res);
00290   }

00293   // Split up a group into a vector of groups based on unique segids...
00294   std::vector<AtomicGroup> AtomicGroup::splitByUniqueSegid(void) const {
00295     const_iterator i;
00296     UniqueStrings unique;
00297 
00298     for (i = atoms.begin(); i != atoms.end(); i++)
00299       unique.add((*i)->segid());
00300 
00301     int n = unique.size();
00302     int j;
00303     std::vector<AtomicGroup> results(n);
00304     for (i = atoms.begin(); i != atoms.end(); i++) {
00305       j = unique.find((*i)->segid());
00306       if (j < 0)
00307         throw(std::runtime_error("Could not find an atom we already found..."));
00308       results[j].append(*i);
00309     }
00310 
00311     std::vector<AtomicGroup>::iterator g;
00312     for (g=results.begin(); g!=results.end(); g++) {
00313       g->box = box;
00314     }
00315 
00316     return(results);
00317   }
00318 
00319   std::map<std::string, AtomicGroup> AtomicGroup::splitByName(void) const {
00320     const_iterator i;
00321     std::map<std::string, AtomicGroup> groups;
00322 
00323     // Loop over atoms, adding them to groups based on their name, creating the 
00324     // map entry for each new name as we find it
00325     std::map<std::string, AtomicGroup>::iterator g;
00326     for (i = atoms.begin(); i != atoms.end(); ++i) {
00327         g = groups.find((*i)->name());
00328         if (g == groups.end()) { // not found, need to create a new AG
00329             AtomicGroup ag;
00330             ag.append(*i);
00331             ag.box = box; // copy the current groups periodic box
00332             groups[(*i)->name()] = ag;
00333         }  else {              // found group for that atom name, 
00334                                // so add the atom to it
00335             g->second.append(*i);
00336         }
00337 
00338     }
00339 
00340     return(groups);
00341   }
00342 
00359   std::vector<AtomicGroup> AtomicGroup::splitByMolecule(void) {
00360     HashInt seen;                      // Track what atoms we've already
00361     // processed... 
00362     std::vector<AtomicGroup> molecules;
00363     AtomicGroup current;               // The molecule we're currently building...
00364 
00365     // If no connectivity, just return the entire group...
00366     if (!hasBonds()) {
00367       sort();
00368       molecules.push_back(*this);
00369     } else {
00370 
00371       int n = size();
00372       for (int i=0; i<n; i++) {
00373         HashInt::iterator it = seen.find(atoms[i]->id());
00374         if (it != seen.end())
00375           continue;
00376       
00377         walkBonds(current, seen, atoms[i]);
00378         if (current.size() != 0) {       // Just in case...
00379           current.sort();
00380           molecules.push_back(current);
00381           current = AtomicGroup();
00382         }
00383       
00384       }
00385     }
00386 
00387     // copy the box over
00388     std::vector<AtomicGroup>::iterator m;
00389     for (m=molecules.begin(); m!=molecules.end(); m++) {
00390       m->box = box;
00391     }
00392     return(molecules);
00393   }
00394 
00395 
00396   void AtomicGroup::walkBonds(AtomicGroup& current, HashInt& seen, pAtom moi) {
00397     int myid = moi->id();
00398     HashInt::iterator it = seen.find(myid);
00399 
00400     // If we've touched this atom before, stop recursing and return.
00401     if (it != seen.end())
00402       return;
00403 
00404     // This is a novel atom, so append it into the group we're currently building.
00405     seen.insert(myid);
00406     current.addAtom(moi);
00407 
00408     // Just in case it's a solo-atom...  This probably should indicate
00409     // some kind of error...?
00410     if (!(moi->hasBonds()))
00411       return;
00412 
00413     // Now find atoms that are bound to the current atom and recurse
00414     // through them...
00415 
00416     std::vector<int> bonds = moi->getBonds();
00417     std::vector<int>::const_iterator citer;
00418     for (citer = bonds.begin(); citer != bonds.end(); citer++) {
00419       pAtom toi = findById(*citer);
00420       if (toi == 0)
00421         throw(std::runtime_error("Missing bonds while trying to walk the connectivity tree."));
00422       walkBonds(current, seen, toi);
00423     }
00424   }
00425 
00426 
00432   std::vector<AtomicGroup> AtomicGroup::splitByResidue(void) const {
00433     std::vector<AtomicGroup> residues;
00434 
00435     int curr_resid = atoms[0]->resid();
00436     std::string curr_segid = atoms[0]->segid();
00437     
00438     AtomicGroup residue;
00439     AtomicGroup::const_iterator ci;
00440     for (ci = atoms.begin(); ci != atoms.end(); ++ci) {
00441       if (curr_resid != (*ci)->resid() || (*ci)->segid() != curr_segid) {
00442         residues.push_back(residue);
00443         residue = AtomicGroup();
00444         curr_resid = (*ci)->resid();
00445         curr_segid = (*ci)->segid();
00446       } 
00447       residue.append(*ci);
00448     }
00449     
00450     if (residue.size() != 0)
00451       residues.push_back(residue);
00452     
00453     return(residues);
00454   }
00455 
00456 
00457   // Find an atom based on atomid
00458   // Returns 0 (null shared_ptr) if not found...
00459   pAtom AtomicGroup::findById(const int id) {
00460     sort();
00461     int bottom = 0, top = size()-1, middle;
00462 
00463     while (top > bottom) {
00464       middle = bottom + (top - bottom) / 2;
00465       if (atoms[middle]->id() < id)
00466         bottom = middle + 1;
00467       else
00468         top = middle;
00469     }
00470 
00471     if (atoms[bottom]->id() == id)
00472       return(atoms[bottom]);
00473 
00474     return(pAtom());
00475   }
00476 
00482   AtomicGroup AtomicGroup::groupFromID(const std::vector<int> &id_list) {
00483     AtomicGroup result;
00484 
00485     result.box = box;
00486 
00487     for (unsigned int i=0; i<id_list.size(); i++) {
00488       pAtom pa = findById(id_list[i]);
00489       if (!pa) throw(std::out_of_range("Atom id doesn't exist"));
00490       result.addAtom(pa);
00491     }
00492     return(result);
00493   }
00494 
00495   // Get all atoms associated with the residue that contains the
00496   // passed atom...  The returned atoms will not be in order.  If
00497   // you want that, then explicitly sort the group.
00498   AtomicGroup AtomicGroup::getResidue(pAtom res) {
00499     iterator i;
00500     AtomicGroup result;
00501 
00502     result.box = box;
00503     i = find(atoms.begin(), atoms.end(), res);
00504     if (i == atoms.end())
00505       return(result);
00506 
00507     iterator j = i;
00508 
00509     while (j >= atoms.begin()) {
00510       if ((*j)->resid() == res->resid() && (*j)->segid() == res->segid())
00511         result.addAtom(*j);
00512       else
00513         break;
00514       --j;
00515     }
00516 
00517     j = i+1;
00518     while (j < atoms.end()) {
00519       if ((*j)->resid() == res->resid() && (*j)->segid() == res->segid())
00520         result.addAtom(*j);
00521       else
00522         break;
00523 
00524       ++j;
00525     }
00526   
00527     return(result);
00528   }

00531   // renumber the atomids of the group...
00532   void AtomicGroup::renumber(const int start, const int stride) {
00533     iterator i;
00534     int id = start;
00535 
00536     for (i=atoms.begin(); i != atoms.end(); i++, id += stride)
00537       (*i)->id(id);
00538   }

00541   // Get the min and max atomid's...
00542   int AtomicGroup::minId(void) const {
00543     const_iterator i;
00544 
00545     if (atoms.size() == 0)
00546       return(-1);
00547 
00548     int min = atoms[0]->id();
00549     for (i = atoms.begin()+1; i != atoms.end(); i++)
00550       if ((*i)->id() < min)
00551         min = (*i)->id();
00552 
00553     return(min);
00554   }

00561       return(-1);
00562     int max = atoms[0]->id();
00563     for (i=atoms.begin()+1; i != atoms.end(); i++)
00564       if ((*i)->id() > max)
00565         max = (*i)->id();

00567     return(max);
00568   }

00600   // Count the number of higher structural elements...
00601   int AtomicGroup::numberOfResidues(void) const {
00602 
00603     if (atoms.size() == 0)
00604       return(0);
00605 
00606     const_iterator i;
00607     int n = 1;
00608     int curr_resid = atoms[0]->resid();
00609     std::string curr_segid = atoms[0]->segid();
00610 
00611     for (i=atoms.begin()+1; i !=atoms.end(); i++)
00612       if (((*i)->resid() != curr_resid) || 
00613           ((*i)->segid() != curr_segid)) {
00614         ++n;
00615         curr_resid = (*i)->resid();
00616         curr_segid = (*i)->segid();
00617       }
00618 
00619     return(n);
00620   }
00621 
00622 
00623   int AtomicGroup::numberOfSegids(void) const {
00624 
00625     if (atoms.size() == 0)
00626       return(0);
00627 
00628     const_iterator i;
00629     int n = 1;
00630     std::string curr_segid = atoms[0]->segid();
00631 
00632     for (i=atoms.begin()+1; i !=atoms.end(); i++)
00633       if ((*i)->segid() != curr_segid) {
00634         ++n;
00635         curr_segid = (*i)->segid();
00636       }
00637 
00638     return(n);
00639   }

00644     AtomicGroup res;
00645     res.append(lhs);
00646     res.append(rhs);
00647     return(res);
00648   }

00658 
00659   bool AtomicGroup::operator==(AtomicGroup& rhs) {
00660 
00661     if (size() != rhs.size())
00662       return(false);
00663 
00664     if (this == &rhs)
00665       return(true);
00666 
00667     sort();
00668     rhs.sort();
00669 
00670     int n = size();
00671     for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)
00672       if (atoms[i] != rhs.atoms[i])
00673         return(false);
00674 
00675     return(true);
00676   }
00677 
00678 
00679   bool AtomicGroup::operator==(const AtomicGroup& rhs) const {
00680     if (size() != rhs.size())
00681       return(false);
00682 
00683     if (this == &rhs)
00684       return(true);
00685 
00686     const std::vector<pAtom> *lp;
00687     const std::vector<pAtom> *rp;
00688     std::vector<pAtom> lhs_atoms, rhs_atoms;
00689     CmpById comp;
00690     if (!sorted()) {
00691       lhs_atoms = atoms;
00692       std::sort(lhs_atoms.begin(), lhs_atoms.end(), comp);
00693       lp = &lhs_atoms;
00694     } else
00695       lp = &atoms;
00696 
00697     if (!rhs.sorted()) {
00698       rhs_atoms = rhs.atoms;
00699       std::sort(rhs_atoms.begin(), rhs_atoms.end(), comp);
00700       rp = &rhs_atoms;
00701     } else
00702       rp = &rhs.atoms;
00703 
00704     int n = size();
00705     for (int i = 0; i<n; i++)
00706       if ((*lp)[i] != (*rp)[i])
00707         return(false);
00708 
00709     return(true);
00710   }
00711 
00712 
00713   void AtomicGroup::reimage() {
00714     if (!(isPeriodic()))
00715       throw(std::runtime_error("trying to reimage a non-periodic group"));
00716     GCoord com = centroid();
00717     GCoord reimaged = com;
00718     reimaged.reimage(periodicBox());
00719     GCoord trans = reimaged - com;
00720     const_iterator a;
00721     for (a=atoms.begin(); a!=atoms.end(); a++) {
00722       (*a)->coords() += trans;
00723     }
00724   }
00725 
00726   void AtomicGroup::reimageByAtom () {
00727     if (!(isPeriodic()))
00728       throw(std::runtime_error("trying to reimage a non-periodic group"));
00729     const_iterator a;
00730     GCoord box = periodicBox();
00731     for (a=atoms.begin(); a!=atoms.end(); a++) {
00732       (*a)->coords().reimage(box);
00733     }
00734   }
00735     
00736 
00741   AtomicGroup AtomicGroup::within(const double dist, AtomicGroup& grp) {
00742     int na = size();
00743     int nb = grp.size();
00744     AtomicGroup res;
00745 
00746     res.box = box;
00747     double dist2 = dist * dist;
00748     std::vector<int> ids;
00749 
00750     for (int j=0; j<nb; j++) {
00751       for (int i=0; i<na; i++) {
00752         if (atoms[i]->coords().distance2(grp.atoms[j]->coords()) <= dist2)
00753           ids.push_back(atoms[i]->id());
00754       }
00755     }
00756 
00757     // Abort the rest if nothing was found...
00758     if (ids.size() == 0)
00759       return(res);
00760 
00761     std::vector<int> unique_ids;
00762     std::sort(ids.begin(), ids.end());
00763     std::vector<int>::const_iterator ci;
00764     int last_id = ids[0];
00765     unique_ids.push_back(last_id);
00766     for (ci = ids.begin()+1; ci != ids.end(); ci++)
00767       if (*ci != last_id) {
00768         last_id = *ci;
00769         unique_ids.push_back(last_id);
00770       }
00771 
00772     for (ci = unique_ids.begin(); ci != unique_ids.end(); ci++) {
00773       pAtom pa = findById(*ci);
00774       if (pa == 0)
00775         throw(std::logic_error("Cannot find a found atom in AtomicGroup::atomsWithin()"));
00776 
00777       res.addAtom(pa);
00778     }
00779 
00780     return(res);
00781   }
00782 
00783 
00784   void AtomicGroup::findBonds(const double dist) {
00785     AtomicGroup::iterator ij;
00786     double dist2 = dist * dist;
00787     
00788     for (ij = begin(); ij != end() - 1; ++ij) {
00789       AtomicGroup::iterator ii;
00790       GCoord u = (*ij)->coords();
00791 
00792       for (ii = ij + 1; ii != end(); ++ii) {
00793         if (u.distance2((*ii)->coords()) < dist2) {
00794           (*ij)->addBond(*ii);
00795           (*ii)->addBond(*ij);
00796         }
00797       }
00798     }
00799   }
00800 
00801   // XMLish output...
00802   std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const AtomicGroup& grp) {
00803     AtomicGroup::const_iterator i;
00804     if (grp.isPeriodic())
00805       os << "<GROUP PERIODIC='" << grp.box.box() << "'>\n";
00806     else
00807       os << "<GROUP>\n";
00808     for (i=grp.atoms.begin(); i != grp.atoms.end(); i++)
00809       os << "   " << **i << std::endl;
00810     os << "</GROUP>";
00811 
00812     return(os);
00813   }
00814 
00815 
00816 }
